title: Man, 83, dies and two other pensioners injured in 'tragic incident' in woods
text:

A pensioner has died and two others have been injured in a "tragic incident" in a remote woodlands.

The tragedy, which police described as "incredibly rare", has rocked the rural community around Birkenhill Woods, near Elgin, northeast Scotland.

It's thought the three victims were attacked in the woodland at around 9am on Monday.

Daily Record says one 83-year-old man, named locally as Frank Kinnis, since died of his injuries.

Another man and woman, both aged 70, were taken to hospital with serious injuries but not thought to be life-threatening at this stage.

Frank was known to walk his alsatian dog in the woods on a daily basis and lived nearby in cottages with wife Muriel.

"First and foremost, I'm sure I speak on behalf of everyone within North East Division when I say my thoughts are with the family and friends of all those affected by this tragic incident," Detective Inspector Brian Geddes, of Police Scotland's major investigation team, said.

A 35-year-old man has been arrested but Police Scotland said it was unable to confirm further details, including the offence on suspicion of which he's been detained.

Det Insp Geddes continued: "I know the circumstances will understandably cause concern within the local community, particularly because incidents of this nature are so incredibly rare.

"A man has been arrested and as our investigation continues, I urge anyone with information to contact Police on 101 quoting ref. no. 0667 of Oct 21.

"Alternatively you can contact Crimestoppers on 0800 555111 to remain completely anonymous.

"While our inquiries continue, additional patrols will be carried out in the area and I would urge anyone with concerns to speak to any of our officers."

The investigation continues.
description: Police Scotland conceded "incidents of this nature are so incredibly rare" after the tragedy in remote Birkenhill Woods near Elgin, northeast Scotland
